alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 6:51AM PST until January 14 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in California... Russian River near Hopland affecting Mendocino County. For the Russian River...including Hopland...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Russian River near Hopland. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Significant flooding of Highway 175 at the approaches to the Russian River bridge. Minor flooding of Highway 222 near Ukiah, and in crop land along the left and right banks of the Russian River near Hopland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM PST Sunday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 21.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 AM PST Sunday was 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this morning to 4.2 feet Tuesday evening. It will rise to 6.6 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.5 feet on 01/17/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Russian River Hopland 15.0 16.1 Sun 5 am PST 5.9 4.5 6.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at noon PST.
